main event: The report describes a sighting of a bright, incandescent object that was observed due southwest and 5 degrees above the horizon from a ship's position. The object descended straight down before disappearing below the horizon.
interesting points: The object was observed to be very large and was described as a probable 'Meteorite'.
The sighting occurred in the Pacific Ocean at coordinates 4 South 85 West.
The weather conditions were reported as partly cloudy and calm.
The sighting was reported by the crew of the SS Normacisle ship.
The object was observed to be hovering and then moved away rapidly before crashing into the sea.
witnesses: Crew of the SS Normacisle ship
